result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Donte Martez Johnson Jr

records.addlTxt: Filed: Original Transcript of Preliminary Hearing ( 22 pages) commencing 09-12-2022 by Amy De La Rosa.

Defendant Donte Martez Johnson Jr appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jade K Hall in court for Donte Martez Johnson Jr.  Attorney Francesco Mineo in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Arraignment. Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Case adjourned for a Status Conference date to Br 16.
Status conference scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Defendant logged into zoom but lost connection; case adjourned for arraignment for September 28, 2022 at 8:45 am; VIA ZOOM, both parties agreed to date and time.

Defendant Donte Martez Johnson Jr appeared by video, in custody in MSDF.  Attorney Jade K Hall appeared by video for Donte Martez Johnson Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Court took judicial notice of case #16CF2418. Sworn for the State: West Allis PD Officer D. Schneider. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed. Defense requests an arraignment. Case is adjourned to Branch 16.
Arraignment scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Donte Martez Johnson in court, in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Donte Martez Johnson in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Defendant Donte Martez Johnson in custody at MSDF.  Michael J. Odden appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Donte Martez Johnson appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case will be heard in room 503 of the courthouse.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 10:00 am.
